wikipedia_page.main: Group Captain Anthony Rex Arnold   (26 August 1896 – 25 May 1954) was a British World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories.

response: By the end of 1917, surviving Triplanes were used as advanced trainers with No. 12 Naval Squadron. For a time, the type remained in use for experimental and training purposes; examples were recorded as performing flights as late as October 1918.Bruce 1965, pp. 9-10. Six British aces scored all of their victories on Sopwith Triplanes. These were John Albert Page (7), Thomas Culling (6), Cyril Askew Eyre (6), F. H. Maynard (6), Gerald Ewart Nash (6) and Anthony Arnold (5).
Anthony Arnold, Charles Dawson Booker, Robert J. O. Compston, Harold Day, Stanley Goble,
| Gunner: C.W. Weir; victory shared with Anthony Arnold RNAS
